intro: Aeollanthus angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved aeollanthus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, narrow leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks. Aeollanthus angustifolius is often found in regions with high humidity and is adapted to thrive in nutrient-rich soils.
